required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase I, Randomized, Double-Blind, Single-Dose, Dose Escalation Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of MEDI-557
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Randomized, Double-Blind, Single-Dose, Dose-Escalation Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of MEDI-557, A Humanized Monoclonal Antibody With an Extended Half-Life Against Respiratory Syncytial Virus (RSV), in Healthy Adults

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of a single IV dose of MEDI-557.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of a single IV dose of MEDI-557 administered to healthy adult subjects in 4 dose cohorts.

primary_outcome.measure: The occurrence of AEs from the period immediately following study drug administration
The occurrence of laboratory AEs from the period immediately following study drug administration
The occurrence of SAEs from the period immediately following study drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: The single-dose pharmacokinetic parameters of IV MEDI-557 and motavizumab monitored using noncompartmental analysis.

arm_group.description: Single IV dose of 0.3 mg/kg MEDI-557
Single IV dose of 3 mg/kg MEDI-557
Single IV dose of 15 mg/kg MEDI-557
Single IV dose of 30 mg/kg MEDI-557

link.description: Click here and search for drug information provided by the FDA.
Click here and search for information on any recalls, market or product safety alerts by the FDA which might have occurred with this product.
